sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"地图，图"之意。
means: chart ： 指航海地图，也指图表。
map ： 指标有国家大小、城市、铁路、河流、山脉、海洋等的地图。
graph ： 多指用纵横坐标之间关系的曲线表示两个量之间的图表。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"名单，目录，表格"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: list, catalog(ue), rgeister, roll, schedule, table, chart, form
means: list ： 最普通用词，含义广。指按字母顺序、时间先后或类别等排列的姓名或项目等的单子。
catalog(ue) ： 指列出有全部队名、物名或项目等的目录，有时附有简要说明的分类名单或一览表。
rgeister ： 多指官方对人或事作出的正式书面记录或详细清单。
roll ： 多指人员的姓名名单，尤指属于团体或军事单位的全体人员名单。
schedule ： 既可指时间或计划的安排表，又可指详细列出的所有分类项的清单或细表。
table ： 普通用词，一般指易于迅速查阅使用，具有特定编排方法的目录或表格。
chart ： 指把资料制成表格等形式供人看的图表。
form ： 指上面印有横线或格让人填写规定内容的表格。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French charte, from Latin charta 'paper, papyrus leaf' (see card)

entry.def: A chart is a diagram, picture, or graph which is intended to make information easier to understand.

example.ex: Male unemployment was 14.2%, compared with 5.8% for women (see chart on next page)...
example.tran: 相比女性的5.8%，男性失业率为14.2%(见下页图表)。

example.ex: The chart below shows our top 10 choices.
example.tran: 下图是我们优先考虑的10个选择。

entry.def: A chart is a map of the sea or stars.

entry.tran: 绘制…的地图(或海图、星位图)
entry.def: If you chart an area of land, sea, or sky, or a feature in that area, you make a map of the area or show the feature in it.

example.ex: Portuguese explorers had charted the west coast of Africa as far as Sierra Leone...
example.tran: 葡萄牙探险家已经绘制出了远至塞拉里昂的非洲西海岸地图。

example.ex: Ptolemy charted more than 1000 stars in 48 constella-tions...
example.tran: 托勒密绘制了48个星座1,000多颗恒星的星位图。

entry.def: The charts are the official lists that show which CDs have sold the most copies each week.

example.ex: This album confirmed The Orb's status as national stars, going straight to Number One in the charts...
example.tran: 这张专辑确立了The Orb作为全国明星的地位，销量直升至排行榜首位。

example.ex: They topped both the US singles and album charts at the same time.
example.tran: 他们同时荣登美国单曲榜和专辑榜榜首。

entry.def: If you chart the development or progress of something, you observe it and record or show it. You can also say that a report or graph charts the development or progress of something.

example.ex: One GP has charted a dramatic rise in local childhood asthma since the M25 was built nearby...
example.tran: 一位全科医生跟踪记录发现，自从附近修建了25号高速公路以来，当地哮喘病患儿数量急剧增加。

example.ex: This magnificent show charts his meteoric rise from 'small town' country singer to top international Rock idol...
example.tran: 这场盛大的演出展示了他是如何从一个“小镇”乡村歌手一跃成为国际顶级摇滚偶像的。

entry.def: If a person or plan charts a course of action, they describe what should be done in order to achieve something or to make progress in the future.

example.ex: We've charted a possible way forward...
example.tran: 我们已经制订了下一步可能的计划。

example.ex: NATO had charted a new course for stability and cooperation in Europe...
example.tran: 北约制订了保持欧洲稳定与合作的新计划。

means.word_mean: 2. a map designed to assist navigation by air or sea

sentences.en: The course of a ship is marked on a chart.
sentences.cn: 轮船的航线是标在航海图上的。

sentences.en: That song has been in the charts for weeks.
sentences.cn: 那首歌已有好几周都上了流行榜。

means.word_mean: 绘制地图, 在图上标出

sentences.en: The navigator charted the course of the ship.
sentences.cn: 领航员在航海图上标出船的航线。

means.word_mean: 记录; 记述; 跟踪（进展或发展）

sentences.en: The book charts her rise to fame as an actress.
sentences.cn: 这本书记述了她作为演员的成名史。
